title: Trump administration expands travel ban to include six new countries
description: The Trump administration on Friday announced an expansion of the travel ban -- one of the President's signature policies, which has been derided by critics as an attempt to ban Muslims from the US -- to include six new countries.

title: Suspects arrested after SUV breaches Mar-a-Lago security
description: An SUV breached security checkpoints heading toward the main entrance of President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago retreat in Florida on Friday, and officials shot at the vehicle, the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office said.

title: Trump loosens restrictions on landmines
description: President Donald Trump rescinded restrictions on the US military's ability to use landmines, weapons that have been banned by more than 160 countries due to their history of killing and wounding civilians, the White House said Friday.

title: Record-breaking Nike shoes to be banned
description: A range of high-tech Nike shoes which have revolutionized running have escaped a ban, but prototypes with thick soles and several carbon fiber plates are to be outlawed in competition in a bid to preserve the integrity of athletics.

title: Heiress with estimated $17 billion is dead
description: Anne Cox Chambers, who with her sister took over the family media conglomerate that became Cox Enterprises and once served as US ambassador to Belgium, died Friday at her Atlanta home at the age of 100, the company said.

title: WWE stock gets body slammed after co-presidents step down
description: The news just keeps getting worse for World Wrestling Entertainment, and WWE investors must feel like they've been choke slammed and dragged to hell by Universal Champion Bray "The Fiend" Wyatt.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow's 'Goop' treatments slammed by UK health chief
description: A top UK health official has criticized Gwyneth Paltrow's lifestyle brand Goop for promoting treatments that pose "considerable risks to health."

title: Kobe Bryant's family says inaccurate reports are adding to the pain
description: Kobe Bryant's family is requesting privacy following the death of the NBA star and his daughter, saying inaccurate reports are only adding to the pain for his grieving loved ones.

title: Indian man killed in police shoot-out after holding 23 children hostage at fake birthday party
description: A man who held 23 children hostage after inviting them to a fake birthday party for his daughter has been killed by police in northern India, local authorities said Friday.

title: 49ers general manager John Lynch meets ... CNN's John Lynch
description: San Francisco's "Captain America" has reached the Super Bowl. And so have I.

title: A mirrored heart lands in Times Square
description: The winning entry for the 2020 Times Square Valentine Heart Design Competition has been unveiled in Manhattan, where it will be on display until the end of February.

title: Intuitive eating: The anti-diet, or how pleasure from food is the answer, say its creators
description: Call it the anti-diet.

title: First Italian city to offer $1 homes
State of emergency declared in Australia capital
description: A state of emergency has been declared in Australia's capital city of Canberra as bushfires move rapidly in the area, according to authorities from the Australian Capital Territory (ACT).

title: Larry Nassar's abuse victims offered $215M
description: USA Gymnastics offered Larry Nassar's victims a $215 million settlement on Thursday as part of a plan for the organization to exit bankruptcy.

title: Dominic Thiem sets up first Australian Open final with victory over Alexander Zverev
description: Austria's Dominic Thiem will compete in his first Australian Open final after defeating Alexander Zverev 3-6 6-4 7-6 7-6.

title: As coronavirus spreads, fear is fueling racism and xenophobia
description: On a French newspaper's front page last weekend, big block letters announced "Yellow Alert" next to an image of a Chinese woman wearing a face mask. Another headline in the same paper read "New Yellow Peril?" above an article about the ongoing Wuhan coronavirus outbreak.

title: Living under lockdown: How Wuhan residents are coping
description: Residents of Wuhan, China, describe what life is like under lockdown in the city at the center of the novel coronavirus outbreak. The virus has killed 170 people and infected nearly 8,000 others in China. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: Premier League January spending reaches $2 billion, but transfers come with a warning sign
description: Time and again, the January transfer window has proven to be a minefield for English Premier League clubs looking to make big money signings.

title: Reward offered to remove tire stuck on 13ft crocodile's neck for years
description: A province in Indonesia is offering a reward to anyone brave enough to free an enormous wild crocodile from a motorcycle tire.

title: Aston Martin has been bailed out by Formula 1 billionaire
description: Aston Martin has been rescued from collapse by a £500 million ($656 million) bailout led by a Formula 1 billionaire.

title: Hong Kong art fair faces calls to cancel amid coronavirus fears
description: Organizers of Asia's largest art fair, Art Basel Hong Kong, are facing mounting pressure to postpone or cancel the March event as the deadly Wuhan coronavirus continues to spread around the region.

title: Church of England apologizes for saying only married heterosexuals should have sex
description: Top archbishops in the Church of England have apologized for guidance issued by the church last week that said only married heterosexuals should have sex -- while same-sex or heterosexual Christians in civil partnerships should remain abstinent.

title: Number of Iranian students turned back at US airports is growing
description: They left Iran with valid visas in hand. But hours after landing in the US, they were forced to turn back on flights they never expected to take.

title: 4 years of Brexit in 4 minutes
description: It's been almost four years since the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union - and it's been quite the journey. CNN takes a look at how Brexit unfolded.

title: Millions of Syrian children deprived of basic rights by war
description: A UN report focused solely on children in Syria states that five million have been displaced in the fighting, with nine years of war robbing them of their childhood and subjecting them to "unabated violations of their rights". CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

title: Wetlands are disappearing three times faster than forests
description: While musicians and movie stars campaign vocally to protect our rainforests and oceans, the world's wetlands rarely get the same level of public support. They are in many ways the planet's unglamorous, unsung heroes -- yet by one estimate wetlands are disappearing three times faster than forests.

title: Carli Lloyd eyes 'potential' career as kicker in NFL
description: Carli Lloyd has played in soccer World Cup finals. She's played in Olympic gold medal games. She's played in domestic cup finals.

title: Peppa Pig voice actress Harley Bird to step down after 13 years
description: The actress who has been delighting toddlers as the voice of Peppa Pig for more than a decade is hanging up her puddle-jumping boots and stepping down from the role.

title: Witness vote likely to fail after Lamar Alexander says he's a no
description: Republican Sen. Lamar Alexander of Tennessee said late Thursday he would oppose calling witnesses in the Senate impeachment trial of President Donald Trump, a decision that means the trial is all but certain to come to a swift end without hearing from witnesses or subpoenaing documents.

title: Former K-pop star Seungri indicted on prostitution charges
description: Former K-pop idol Seungri has been indicted on charges including prostitution and habitual gambling, about a year since allegations first came to light in a sexual abuse scandal that has rocked South Korea's entertainment industry.

title: Impeachment trial to end but its aftershocks will rock America
description: America's latest "national nightmare" will not end when Republicans vote to acquit President Donald Trump of high crimes and misdemeanors, possibly as early as Friday.

title: The King Trump defense is terrifying
description: There is a crime against the Constitution going on right underneath the chief justice's nose.

title: More than 200 deaths and almost 9,800 confirmed virus cases worldwide as more travel links with China are cut
Britain is leaving the European Union today. The hard part comes next
description: After three-and-a-half years, three prime ministers and seemingly endless votes in Parliament since the 2016 Brexit referendum, Britain finally becomes the first ever country to leave the European Union at 11:01 p.m. GMT on Friday.

title: 7 questions that still need to be answered about Trump's impeachment
description: The second day of questions in President Donald Trump's impeachment trial began with some drama and some clarity.

title: This teacher's shoes were stolen from his classroom, so his students surprised him
description: They say a picture is worth a thousand words, but in this case, you could say the same about a video of a Nebraska teacher when he got an unexpected gift from his students.

title: Company that owns helicopter in Kobe Bryant crash suspends operations
description: Island Express Helicopters, the company that owns the helicopter that crashed Sunday, killing NBA legend Kobe Bryant and eight others, is "suspending all flight service for operational reasons," two company representatives told CNN on Thursday.

title: Inside the plane evacuated from Wuhan
description: CNN's Kyung Lah spoke to American Jarred Evans who was evacuated from Wuhan, China back to the US following the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. Evans described his experience on the plane and how everyone cheered when it landed.

title: Tom Brady's post to social media causes quite the stir
description: Hey, Tom Brady, future free agent quarterback, would it have troubled you to add a caption to your social media post?

title: Woman who has accused Trump of sexual assault is seeking his DNA
description: A woman who accused President Donald Trump of sexually assaulting her decades ago is asking him for a DNA sample to compare to male genetic material found on the dress she says she wore during the alleged encounter.

title: What Trump's Middle East plan means for Palestinians
description: One does not need to be an expert on history to realize that the map released by President Donald Trump as a deal for peace between Israel and Palestine is identical to the Bantustans of the defunct South African apartheid system, with one difference: The Palestinian isolation islets are comparable to ghettos. So much so, "ghettostans" is a more suitable label for them.

title: Prince Harry loses tabloid complaint
description: Prince Harry has lost a complaint against a British newspaper over a story describing wild animals in photographs that he posted on Instagram as "drugged and tethered."

title: Yes for $350, you can get a life-sized Baby Yoda
description: Many of us are struggling to cope with the fact that "The Mandalorian" Season 1 has wrapped and that we have to wait several months until Season 2. But fear not, young Padawans, for The Child (aka our beloved Baby Yoda) merch will be landing this spring. And now, for $350, you can get a lifesize re-creation of everyone's favorite 50-year-old.

title: Scientists have found a 330-million-year-old shark's head
description: Kentucky's Mammoth Cave National Park is a long way from the ocean, but newly discovered fossils suggest the area was once teeming with sharks.
